text: Technically, it's possible.
However, it can be hard.
If both PHP and Python are writing the file, you'll need to use OS-level locking to assure that they don't overwrite each other.
Each part of your system will have to lock the file, rewrite it from scratch with all the updates, and unlock the file.

childList.text: rewrite it from scratch with all the updates

text: This means that PHP and Python must load the entire file into memory before rewriting it.
There are a couple of ways to handle the OS locking.
Or.
You can rearchitect it so that only Python writes the file.
The front-end reads the file when it changes, and drops off little transaction files to create a work queue for Python.
In this case, you don't have multiple writers -- you have one reader and one writer -- and life is much, much simpler.
